column2: An invalid value is set in the CH1 output range setting by the switch setting for intelligent function module in MELSOFT application.
column3: Reset to the correct parameter with MELSOFT application parameter setting.

column2: An invalid value is set in the CH2 output range setting by the switch setting for intelligent function module in MELSOFT application.
column3: Reset to the correct parameter with MELSOFT application parameter setting.

column2: Module error at startup.
column3: Turn the power ON and OFF again. If the error occurs again, the module may be malfunctioning. Contact the nearest distributor or branch office with a description of the problem.

column2: The value set to the intelligent function switch 5 is other than 0.
column3: Re-set the correct parameter value in the parameter setting of MELSOFT application.

column2: The G(P).OGSTOR instruction was executed in the offset/gain setting mode.
column3: Do not execute the G(P).OGSTOR instruction in the offset/gain setting mode.

column2:
* The G(P).OGSTOR instruction was executed consecutively.
* At the time of offset/gain setting, a set value was written to the E2PROM 26 or more times.
column3:
* Execute the G(P).OGSTOR instruction only once for one module.
* At the time of offset/gain setting, write a set value only once at one time.

column2: The G(P).OGSTOR instruction was executed for the model that differs from the model for which the G(P).OGLOAD instruction had been executed.
column3: Execute the G(P).OGLOAD and G(P).OGSTOR instructions for the same model.

column2: The value set to the G(P).OGLOAD instruction, G(P).OGSTOR instruction or pass data classification setting (buffer memory address 200: Un\G200) is outside the range.
column3: Set the value within the range.

column2: The CH1 offset value is equal to or larger than the gain value.
column3: Reset so that the offset value becomes smaller than the gain value.

column2: The CH2 offset value is equal to or larger than the gain value.
column3: Reset so that the offset value becomes smaller than the gain value.

column2: More than one channel was set at the same time during offset/gain settings.
column3: Set the correct value in buffer memory addresses 22 and 23 (Un\G22 and Un\G23).

column2: The CH1 specified digital value is outside the valid range.
column3: Set a value that is within the valid range.

column2: The CH2 specified digital value is outside the valid range.
column3: Set a value that is within the valid range.

column2: The CH1 warning output upper/lower limit value setting is outside the range -16384 to 16383.
column3: Correct the contents of the buffer memory addresses 86 and 87 (Un\G86 and 87) to within the range -16384 to 16383.

column2: The CH2 warning output upper/lower limit value setting is outside the range -16384 to 16383.
column3: Correct the contents of the buffer memory addresses 88 and 89 (Un\G88 and 89) to within the range -16384 to 16383.

column2: The CH1 warning output lower limit value is equal to or greater than the warning output upper limit value.
column3: Make setting so that the warning output upper limit value is greater than the warning output lower limit value.

column2: The CH2 warning output lower limit value is equal to or greater than the warning output upper limit value.
column3: Make setting so that the warning output upper limit value is greater than the warning output lower limit value.

column2: The analog adjustment output in the offset/gain setting mode is outside the specified value range.
column3: Change the contents of buffer memory address 24 (Un\G24) so that it is within the range from -3000 to 3000.

column2: The offset/gain range setting is outside the range DH to FH.
column3: Correct the contents of the buffer memory address 25 (Un\G25) to within the range DH to FH.

column2: The CH1 increase/decrease digital limit value setting is outside the range 0 to 32000.
column3: Correct the contents of the buffer memory addresses 70 and 71 (Un\G70 and 71) to within the range 0 to 32000.

column2: The CH2 increase/decrease digital limit value setting is outside the range 0 to 32000.
column3: Correct the contents of the buffer memory addresses 72 and 73 (Un\G72 and 73) to within the range 0 to 32000.
